quiz.title: Algebra 1 Review: Quiz 10
quiz.subtitle: Unit 1.10: Exponential Functions and Growth Patterns
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Introduction to Exponential Growth and Decay

questions.question: Which of the following functions represents exponential growth?
questions.explanation: In the form $y = a(b)^x$, growth occurs when the base $b > 1$. Here, $1.2 > 1$.

questions.question: In the exponential function $y = 100(0.95)^x$, what does the value 100 represent?
questions.explanation: The coefficient $a$ in $y = a(b)^x$ represents the initial value or y-intercept (the value when $x = 0$).

questions.question: A population of bacteria doubles every hour. If there are 50 bacteria initially, which equation models the population $P$ after $t$ hours?
Which table of values represents an exponential function?
questions.explanation: The y-values have a common ratio of 3 ($4 \times 3 = 12$, $12 \times 3 = 36$).

questions.question: A car purchased for \$20000 depreciates at a rate of 15% per year. What is the base $b$ for the exponential decay model?
What is the y-intercept of the function $f(x) = 8(3)^x + 2$?
Which of the following describes the graph of $y = 4(0.5)^x$?
questions.explanation: Initial value $a = 4$ and base $b = 0.5$ (less than 1) indicates decay/decreasing.

questions.question: If an investment of \$500 grows by 6% compounded annually, what is the value after 10 years?
Determine the common ratio for the geometric sequence: $2, 10, 50, 250, ...$
questions.explanation: Divide any term by the previous term: $10 / 2 = 5$ or $50 / 10 = 5$.

scoreMessages.90: Fantastic! You've mastered the basics of exponential growth and decay.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Make sure to distinguish between the rate ($r$) and the base ($b$).
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Remember that growth bases are $> 1$ and decay bases are between 0 and 1.
scoreMessages.0: Review the general form $y = a(b)^x$ to better understand exponential patterns.
